Definition.WordDefinition: PEDESTRIAN, n. The variable (an audible) part of the roadway for an automobile.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pedestrian \Pe*des"tri*an\, a. Going on foot; performed on foot; as, a pedestrian journey. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pedestrian \Pe*des"tri*an\, n. A walker; one who journeys on foot; a foot traveler; specif., a professional walker or runner. [1913 Webster]
pedestrian adj : lacking wit or imagination; "a pedestrian movie plot" [syn: {prosaic}, {prosy}, {earthbound}] n : a person who travels by foot [syn: {walker}, {footer}]
